The software update to Windows 8.1 Enterprise that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

The software update to Windows 8.1 Single Language that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

The software update to Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

termGrp.term: Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center Update
Windows 8.1 Pro ᎬᏙᏗ Media Center Update

descripGrp.descrip: The edition of Windows 8.1 designed for enthusiasts and business/technical pros that includes all of the features in Windows 8.1, plus features for encryption, virtualization, PC management, and domain connectivity.
The edition of Windows 8.1 that is available only through volume licensing.
The edition of Windows 8.1 designed to make Windows affordable to mainstream consumers in emerging markets.
The edition of Windows 8.1 Pro that contains Windows Media Center.
The set of features providing accessibility options and settings to help users interact more easily with the product.
A feature or mode in the Windows Maps app that provides turn-by-turn directions with both audio and visual guidance that changes as the user travels along the route to their destination.
The feature that provides quick access to settings and notifications specified by the user.

The ability to emulate the functionality of traditional smart cards, but instead of requiring the purchase of additional hardware, it uses technology that users already own and are more likely to have with them at all times.
A photo you can choose to use as the background for some Live Tiles on the Start screen.
The on-screen keyboard key that traditionally (as in word processing) is used to insert tab characters into a document.
The app category that facilitates engagement with government or politics.
The app category that facilitates management of personal finances.
The app category for photo-related apps.
The app used to provide product feedback that results from the Windows Insider Program.
The external program that enables participants (called "Insiders") to provide feedback on Windows new features.
The external program that enables participants (called "Insiders") to provide feedback on Windows new features.
The participant in the Windows Insider Program.
A Terminal Services session.
The button that takes the user to the previous item or page.
The button pressed to update displayed information with current data.
The tab in a file or folder Properties dialog box that allows the user to set, view, change, or remove file and folder permissions.
The section of the Store that contains a selection of products presented to the customer in a group. The products may be purchased individually.
The section of the Store that shows subgroups of apps and games, grouped by intended use or function.
The section of the Store where account holders can manage their account.
The section of the Store showing the group of apps that the user owns.
The section of the Store where the user can set and update the Store account settings.
An assessment of a Store item on a scale that corresponds to the user's opinion of the content.
A critical evaluation of an item by the customers.
The category in the Store that shows games the user can download.
The name registered in DNS for a computer.
The folder above the current folder in the folder hierarchy. For example, C:\Shares is the parent folder of C:\Shares\public.

The location of a user's profile on the local drive, for example C:\Users\jason. The user profile could be a local profile, which is stored on a single computer, or a roaming user profile, which is synchronized with a file server so that multiple PCs can use the same profile settings.
The command that appears in both email and UX that allows users to put folders in their OneDrive list and allows them to sync those folders offline.
The system clock time.
The settings and data used by a particular application.
The container that is above other containers in a tree hierarchy.
A software that extends the functionality of the Windows Explorer desktop shell.
The use of computer hardware designed to accelerate computer functions.
The version 10 of the Windows operating system that runs on PCs and tablets.
The app experience built into Windows that gives customers a way to contact Microsoft and third-party support for help with their PC.
The app experience built into Windows that gives customers a way to contact Microsoft and third-party support for help with their PC.
The button that invokes the Start menu (desktop) and the Start screen (mobile or desktop).
The full-screen view of Start that includes the list of items, such as apps, websites, and other info that a person can specify and customize. It is what is displayed when the Start button is used.
The full-screen view of Start that includes the list of items, such as apps, websites, and other info that a person can specify and customize. It is what is displayed when the Start button is used.
The resizable view of Start. It can be resized to show the list of items, such as apps, websites, and other info that a person can specify and customize.
The resizable view of Start. It can be resized to show the list of items, such as apps, websites, and other info that a person can specify and customize.
The app in the operating system where the user can manage the builds in the Windows Insider Program.
The app in the operating system where the user can manage the builds in the Windows Insider Program.
The Personalization subcategory containing apps with special themes for your PC and phone.
The top level view in File Explorer that shows the user's most frequently used and most recently used files and folders or folders pinned by the user for quick access.
The feature that provides unending stream of music based not on the user's library, but on an artist or song selected by the user.
To return to Windows 7 after upgrading to Windows 10.
The app where people can find Windows and device settings.
The date when Microsoft no longer provides automatic fixes, updates, or online technical assistance.
The portal where a business or IT manager can purchase UWP apps, and also manage the assignment of app ownership to employees.
To load apps that were not distributed via the Windows Store, usually for testing an app before it is ready for sale.
The service that is installed as part of the MultiPoint role on server and ensures that some MultiPoint configuration settings remain set to keep Windows MultiPoint Server running smoothly.
The menu invoked with a shortcut key (Windows + G) when gaming that allows users to take a screenshot, take a 30 second clip of a game, and adjust volume controls.
The menu invoked with a shortcut key (Windows + G) when gaming that allows users to take a screenshot, take a 30 second clip of a game, and adjust volume controls.
The platform on which the operating system runs on form factors other than PCs, tablets, and phones.
The platform on which the operating system runs on form factors other than PCs, tablets, and phones.

A broad set of all the user's local and cloud-based content, including documents, apps, settings, photos, videos, music, and email. Cortana or Bing can search this content and return it in search results.

The edition of Windows 10 available through volume licensing, that is designed for education institutions, and includes all of the features of Windows 10 Pro, plus some other features like virtualization, management, DirectAccess, and BranchCache.

The edition of Windows 10 that is available only through volume licensing, is designed for businesses, and includes all of the features of Windows 10 Pro, plus some other features like virtualization, management, DirectAccess, and BranchCache.
The edition of Windows 10 designed for HoloLens.
The edition of Windows 10 designed for home users.
The edition of Windows 10 optimized for fixed function IoT devices.
The edition of Windows 10 for a range of powerful IoT devices that provides granular lockdown capabilities, Win32 and modern app support.

The edition of Windows 10 designed for enthusiasts and businesses that includes the features of Home edition while also allowing an organization to manage the device, set policies, control encryption, control updates, and login remotely.
The Microsoft technology that provides access to Windows devices using biometric authentication or a PIN.
The Microsoft technology that provides access to Windows devices using biometric authentication or a PIN.
The feature in Windows that allows a person to connect remotely to someone else's computer to help fix a problem.
The single-language edition of Windows 10 Home.
The evaluation edition of Windows 10 Enterprise.
The long term and less frequent servicing updates for Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 edition.
The long term and less frequent servicing updates for Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 Evaluation edition.

The app that assists customers in upgrading from Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (SP1) or Windows 8.1 Update 1 to Windows 10. It notifies them of the option to upgrade, checks their PC for compatibility, and allows them to reserve a free upgrade.

The website where people can download Microsoft software for recovery (when they own it, but the old copy has been damaged), or first-time installation (when they own the rights, but haven't yet acquired the software itself).
A work area on a computer screen that contains different groups of apps or content open and available for different tasks or aspects of your life.
A work area on a computer screen that contains different groups of apps or content open and available for different tasks or aspects of your life.
A view that displays web articles in a distraction-free layout that is optimized for their screen size.
The prerelease build of Windows 10 for enterprises available to customers in April 2015 or later.
The prerelease build of Windows 10 made available to customers in April 2015 or later. This is the most basic edition of Windows 10 Insider Preview.
The prerelease build of Windows 10 for phones that was made available to Insiders.
The professional edition of Windows 10 Insider Preview released in April 2015 or later.
The prerelease build of the next version of Windows, made available to customers in Spring 2015 or later.
The set of features that seamlessly adapt and optimize the user interface for different devices, modes of working, hardware, or platforms.
The community forum for Windows Insiders.

The variable default lock screen image that shows beautiful images on lock combined with hotspots containing fun facts, Windows tips/trick, and more. Users can switch from this default lock screen to a personal picture.
To add a shortcut to an application or part of an application or contact by fixing its tile to the Start screen (the full screen view of Start) or Start menu.
The section in the Settings app for Windows 10 desktop, containing network and Internet settings.
The large, interactive whiteboard device for collaboration and videoconferencing, designed to advance the way people work together naturally.
The large, interactive whiteboard device for collaboration and videoconferencing, designed to advance the way people work together naturally.
The digital pen designed to work with Surface Pro 3 and Surface 3, enabling effortless writing and drawing in any app that supports inking.
A connected set of episodes or events that run under the same title, usually within the course of one year.
Cellular data that customers can buy from the Windows Store to connect to their Windows device.
A Wi-Fi data or cellular data network that customers can connect to by buying minutes from the Windows Store.
A device (e.g. phone, tablet, or PC) that runs Windows.
A PC that runs Windows.
A phone that runs Windows 10 Mobile.
A tablet device that runs Windows.
A feature that allows you to bookmark webpages and articles to read later.
The UI option on the Start menu to shut down, restart the computer, or put the computer to sleep.
A local area network (LAN) to which mobile users (clients) can connect and communicate by means of high-frequency radio waves rather than wires. WLANs are specified in the IEEE 802.11 standard

The service for downloading Windows updates and Windows Store apps from sources in addition to Microsoft and sending them to other PCs in a local network or on the Internet reducing the amount of Internet bandwidth needed.

The service for downloading Windows updates and Windows Store apps from sources in addition to Microsoft and sending them to other PCs in a local network or on the Internet reducing the amount of Internet bandwidth needed.
To make a record of transactions or activities that take place on a computer system.
A Bluetooth Low Energy device that sends static information, such as location or ID, to devices within its area.

The app for PC and Surface Hub that helps you connect a phone or PC to the Surface Hub display, or to another PC. On Surface Hub, it also allows you to switch between devices that are connected to the Surface Hub.​
A feature that allows customers to temporarily connect to available free Wi-Fi hotspots in order to find and buy Wi-Fi services from the Windows Store.
The web-based interface that is included as part of specialized Windows devices and used by developers to manage device services remotely.
The web-based interface that is included as part of specialized Windows devices and used by developers to manage device services remotely.
The combination of enterprise-related hardware and software security features that, when configured together, will lock a device down so that it can only run trusted applications.​​​
The security feature that uses virtualization-based security to help protect your domain credentials from being collected by malware.

The feature set that integrates data protection at the platform level so as to protect corporate data against inadvertent disclosure to unauthorized users and public services through email, social media and public cloud. It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.

The feature set that integrates data protection at the platform level so as to protect corporate data against inadvertent disclosure to unauthorized users and public services through email, social media and public cloud. It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.

The feature set that integrates data protection at the platform level so as to protect corporate data against inadvertent disclosure to unauthorized users and public services through email, social media and public cloud. It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.
A group of settings that admins can use to manage files and operating system settings on enterprise-owned devices.

The modern implementation of Windows PowerShell built on .NET Core. It includes a command-line shell, scripting language, and automation engine, providing IT administrators comprehensive control and automation of system administration tasks across multiple platforms.
The display technology that provides high-resolution display, touch and ink capabilities, wide-viewing angle, and more.
The view of a particular contact within the People app that shows all your past communication, upcoming meetings, status updates, and files you share with that person. ​
To remove a shortcut to an application or part of an application from the Start screen (the full screen view of Start) or Start menu.
An update where Microsoft delivers new features and other significant changes.
An incremental update that includes bug fixes and security issue resolutions, but no new features.
A screen capture that you can write on, save, and share as an image. ​​​
The Learning Tools feature that highlights verbs and their subordinate clauses.
A privacy setting that allows the operating system, apps, and services to detect a user's approximate location (within several miles/km), without sharing their exact location.
A location that you can set for your device that can be used by Windows, apps, and services when an exact location isn't available, such as on a desktop PC without GPS.​ ​
A biometric authentication feature that that enables signing in to your device, apps, online services, and networks by face recognition.
A biometric authentication feature that that enables signing in to your device, apps, online services, and networks by fingerprint recognition.
A biometric authentication feature that that enables signing in to your device, apps, online services, and networks by iris recognition.
A timeframe that a customer sets to describe when they usually use their device, during which automatic restarts will not happen.
The command that pastes a URL that you copied to your clipboard into the address bar and takes you to the site.
The app included in Windows that allows a trusted friend or support professional to help solve a problem with your PC by accessing and taking control of it over a remote connection.
The app that teachers can use to provision student PCs for classroom use.​

The education app used for secure, online assessments, such as exams. It doesn't allow test takers to access resources stored on their device or the internet; it prevents OS-level distractions; and it doesn't allow test-takers to share test content with other students.​

A person who informally represents their feature team by sharing their expertise with the community in activities such as listening and responding to customer feedback, contributing to community forums, blogging about tips and tricks, and more.
The nickname for Windows 10, version 1607​, used by marketing and executives in announcements about this update, but not in the product.​
The grouping of similar apps together on the taskbar.
A whiteboard-like area in the Windows Ink Workspace. ​
The natural and intuitive inking experience, integrated with Cortana and other Windows features and first-party apps.
The homepage containing frequently used pen apps, suggested pen apps to purchase or download, tips for pen, and quick actions like sticky notes, sketchpad, and screen sketch.
The holographic computer that enables you to interact with high‑definition holograms within an environment such as a living room or an office.
The holographic computer that enables you to interact with high‑definition holograms within an environment such as a living room or an office.
The Windows Defender app available in the Store.
The program that rewards users based on their usage of Microsoft products and allows users to manage, redeem, and showcase their rewards.
The program that rewards users based on their usage of Microsoft products and allows users to manage, redeem, and showcase their rewards.
After a build update, to load an app with domain data (such as data from a database, from the network, or from a file system), during the download process. Before this step, the app cannot be used.

The Windows Hello feature gives business customers the fastest and most secure way to sign-in to Windows devices, apps and services. It uses your face, fingerprint or companion device to recognize you instantly, no password needed.
A feature to enter handwritten text, painting or drawing with your finger tips.

To add a digital signature to additions and updates made to source code and applications published on the Internet. Code signing is intended to provide a level of security and trust to Internet software distribution.
T​o quickly return to an app, website, or document you were using earlier.
A group of documents, apps, and websites that, in one click, allows you to pick up your work exactly where you left it earlier, on any device connected with the same Microsoft account.​​
To quickly jump to a document or application on another device that is connected to the same Microsoft account.
A feature that lets customers reset their network settings back to the Windows defaults.

A control that contains a customizable and extensible collection of ink-related features for Universal Windows apps. By default, the toolbar may include buttons for drawing, erasing, highlighting, setting ink color and stroke thickness, and displaying a ruler.
A device, such as a PC, some tablets, a 2-in-1, or an All-in-one, that uses the traditional Win32 app model and typically make use of COM or .NET runtime.
A device, such as a PC, some tablets, a 2-in-1, or an All-in-one, that uses the traditional Win32 app model and typically make use of COM or .NET runtime.
A business rule that provides explicit, mandatory criteria to use when making a decision or taking action.
The global meeting place (App, Social Media, and website) for Windows users to find more information about Windows, engage with each other and the Windows Engineering team, and provide feedback.
The global meeting place (App, Social Media, and website) for Windows users to find more information about Windows, engage with each other and the Windows Engineering team, and provide feedback.
The offline scanning tool that runs from a trusted environment, without starting your operating system.
The button that allows users to change text size for an entire document.
A feature that allows users to change letter, word, line, and column spacing to reduce visual crowding.
A feature that reads text in an application to the user, highlighting the words as they are read.​
A feature that separates the syllables of each word with a dot, making content more easily readable for some people.

Literally, "without stroke"; describes any typeface in which the characters have no serifs (the short lines or ornaments at the upper and lower ends of the strokes.) A sans serif typeface usually possesses a more straightforward, geometric appearance than a typeface with serifs and typically lacks the contrast between thick and thin strokes found in serif faces.

The drawing app you can use to create simple or elaborate drawings. These drawings can be either black-and-white or color. You can also use Paint to work with pictures, such as .jpg, .gif, or .bmp files.

The drawing app you can use to create simple or elaborate drawings. These drawings can be either black-and-white or color. You can also use Paint to work with pictures, such as .jpg, .gif, or .bmp files.
A bar, appearing at the top, that displays a small preview image (thumbnail) of the content in each open tab.
A feature that allows you to see a small preview of the content in each open tab, shown in a persistent bar (not just on mouseover)​.
To clear or remove all tabs that are currently displayed, and save them as a set of tabs that you can restore later.
A record of the software updates installed in the product.
A rough, hand-drawn sketch.
The font style that applies a classic look to the typography of the book that is being read.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to maximize reading comprehension and speed.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read, resembling a newspaper or other news source.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to minimize clutter and create a clean look.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to make it look more fun and friendly.
The Microsoft touchscreen accessory for Surface devices that allows users to access menus and scroll and swipe through documents and images.
The Microsoft all-in-one touchscreen computer.
The feature within Microsoft Edge where people can access e-books and other e-publications that they purchase or download.
A feature that allows the user to convert an image of writing to editable digital ink.
The feature which allows you to stay connected and quickly interact and share with the people you care about most.
The major Windows 10 update to be released in Spring 2017, focused on creativity, 3D and mixed reality, 4K gaming, game broadcasting, among other features for both consumer and enterprise audiences.
A virtual environment in which a user's real surroundings are combined with virtual or holographic objects to create a customizable environment
A setting that adjusts the display to eliminate blue tones that may disrupt your ability to sleep at night.
A group of similar feedback displayed in search results, instead of showing all the duplicate feedback.
The area of the collection that contains the feedback you submitted.
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains app install rule, SmartScreen settings, and exploit protection settings.​​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains information and actions related to performance and PC health.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app for ​family features, linking o the Family tab of the Microsoft account portal.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains​ Windows Firewall and other network settings.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains all functionalities related to antivirus and threat protection.​​
A series of characters used to verify an account.
The result of remixing existing media to create a new version of that thing.
A virtual object made of light, which can be placed in physical or virtual space
The app in Windows Mixed Reality and on HoloLens that allows users to view and place holograms in their physical or virtual environment.
The app in Windows Mixed Reality and on HoloLens that allows users to view and place holograms in their physical or virtual environment.
A network status tag that appears underneath an available Wi-Fi network and allows to select it in Windows network flyout.
The umbrella security brand for protecting Windows devices and users from malware and other threats.

The hardware-based container technology for apps, initially designed to host Microsoft Edge in order to enhance its security by using Microsoft's Hyper-V virtualization solution and leveraging device's hardware to run untrusted sites in a virtual machine.

The hardware-based container technology for apps, initially designed to host Microsoft Edge in order to enhance its security by using Microsoft's Hyper-V virtualization solution and leveraging device's hardware to run untrusted sites in a virtual machine.
The name for the integrated comercial console which includes antivirus, Device Guard, Firewall, and a number of other Windows devices features from a monitoring and response perspective.

The name of a Windows feature that enables IT to lock down devices so they can only use trusted devices and peripherals, and provides the capability to isolate parts of the operating system by using virtualization-based security (VBS).​
The mixed-reality shell experience, in which content can be placed and used in virtual (or, in the case of HoloLens, real) surroundings.

A UI screen that appears in the Network flyout when a paid Wi-Fi hotspot is in range and paid Wi-Fi plans are available from Windows Store. A customer can then tap Connect with a data plan to open the Paid Wi-Fi & Cellular app, choose a paid Wi-Fi data plan that’s offered from Windows Store, and then buy a plan using the payment information that’s stored in their Microsoft account.

Any very simple computer program that outputs or displays the words "Hello World" in some form to the user. Such a program is often created as an example, to introduce the basic syntax of a programming language to students or others new to that language.
A web application on Xbox.com that allows Xbox One or PC gamers to design and purchase their own Xbox Wireless controller.
Video content that provides a view in all directions, so the user can look around ​as if they are inside the video itself. It can be played on a PC, p​hone, Xbox, or AR/VR headset.
The branded spatial sound format that Microsoft is offering ​for headphones.

The edition of Windows 10 designed for small and medium businesses that includes the features of Windows 10 Pro, plus additional management policies that can be helpful to business customers. This edition is only available through subscription as part of a larger package of services, and is not available as a standalone download.
In Windows Mixed Reality and Windows Holographic, an app type or app state in which the app renders as a flat window, not an immersive experience.​

Sound that is spatialized or is precisely located around a listener in 3D space. Developers can use spatial sound in an application to convincingly place sounds in a 3D space all around the user. Sounds will then seem as if they are coming from real physical objects even though the user may only be using regular stereo headphones.

Technology that enables a 3D graphics processor to display the image at the moment it is rendered for more fluid and better detailed gameplay, and for reducing or eliminating lag, stutter and frame tearing.

Technology that enables a 3D graphics processor to display the image at the moment it is rendered for more fluid and better detailed gameplay, and for reducing or eliminating lag, stutter and frame tearing.

A movie created in the Photos app, featuring a set of related pictures and videos combined with a soundtrack, transitions and other effects. This term can also be used to refer to the set of photos and videos included in the story. ​A story may be created automatically by the app, or manually by the user.
A feature in Holograms app that allows the user to input text and have that text become a hologram that they can place in their space. User inputs text to make a holographic label.
The edition of Microsoft HoloLens hardware and software released for developers.
The edition of HoloLens sold for organizations. Includes the HoloLens Development Edition hardware, plus a warranty and enterprise features for added security and device management.
An action or mechanism to explicitly consent to participate in programs or offerings, typically for marketing purposes.
An action or mechanism to explicitly decline to participate in programs or offerings, typically for marketing purposes.
The Windows Holographic SKU that runs on the HoloLens Commercial Suite, when an Enterprise license is applied to the device.
An e-book file format with the extension .epub that can be downloaded and read on devices like smartphones, tablets, computers.

A graphic UI control consisting of a string of horizontal stars that allows users to report their level of satisfaction with a product, service, or experience and that visually indicates the aggregated rating of all users.
A person who develops programs, services, or other products for use with Microsoft systems and/or products.
A monthly subscription that provides unlimited access to a catalog of games, including popular backward compatible Xbox 360 and blockbuster Xbox One titles.
A socket allowing computer memory (RAM) to be inserted into the computer.

An extension to the Windows Insider Program to include engagement for enterprises and SMEs through dedicated forums, blogs and events, regular surveys with IT professionals, as well as extensive documentation to support their organizations deploy Insider builds.

An extension to the Windows Insider Program to include engagement for enterprises and SMEs through dedicated forums, blogs and events, regular surveys with IT professionals, as well as extensive documentation to support their organizations deploy Insider builds.
A website that customers can go to for help with Microsoft products.
In mixed reality, an app view in which the app takes over the full display and becomes the only app you see.

In Windows Mixed Reality​, the desktop app that allows the user to manage their mixed reality headset, get status on their mixed reality hardware, see a live stream of what's visible in the headset, and complete system setup.​
The mixed reality experience built into Windows that powers a compatible virtual reality headset or head-mounted display.

A container for a collection of configuration settings file with extension .ppkg. Provisioning packages are simple enough that with a short set of written instructions, a student or non-technical employee can use them to configure their device.
The academic disciplines of science, technology, engineering and mathematics, used when addressing education policy and curriculum choices in schools.

A collaborative work space, tool, app, or program for making, learning, exploring and sharing. It can refer to a literal space or place, or to digital environments where people are encouraged to create and share with a community.
A test with important consequences for the test taker or which is the basis of a major decision.
The portal where admins in educational institutions can acquire and distribute apps for their students, faculty, and staff to use.​​

An app that enables the users to view, organize, edit and share all of their photos and videos from multiple sources, and tell stories with them by making them into new videos. It replaces the default Photos app in Windows 10.

A feature within the Microsoft Rewards program, similar to the Punchcard experience within Xbox Live Rewards (which is transitioning into Microsoft Rewards). Users complete X, Y, and Z - things like daily quizzes, searches, and offers - to get a certain number of points.
A record of all purchases made by a user from an online store or portal.
A technology that enables Wi-Fi devices to connect directly, without a router or other mechanism, making it simpler to do things like print, share, sync, and display.​
An app that enables members of a Language community to provide translation and language-related feedback about features. The app is currently available only for Windows Desktop.
A request to gather and send language feedback using quests in Feedback Hub and the Language Community app.​
To take an existing story in the Photos app and generate a new version of that story with edits to content, style, music, and other options.​

In Groove Music app, a graphical display that changes colors and shapes on the screen in response to the music that is playing. The user can choose from several different visualizers, which each look different.

The setting (toggle) on account.microsoft.com/family that, when switched on, requires children to get adult permission for the things they buy in the Windows and Xbox stores — except for what they get with gift cards or money in their Microsoft account.
The capability of Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection, which helps protect the data in the specified folder locations from modification by suspicious or malicious apps.
A feature in Groove Music that allows the sound in specified frequency bands to be amplified or reduced, in order to adjust the quality and character of the sound.​
A group of people who uses or shares a common language or dialect and contributes to language-related activities for Windows features.
A section in the Feedback Hub app where users can organize language-related activities for their Language community.
The capability of Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection, which helps protect against malware that uses exploits to infect devices and spread.

A hardware accessory that allows you to take action in mixed reality. It tracks a precise position in space, allowing for fine-grained interaction with digital objects. When using a Windows Mixed Reality immersive headset, the motion controller is the primary way to take action.

A hardware accessory that allows you to take action in mixed reality. It tracks a precise position in space, allowing for fine-grained interaction with digital objects. When using a Windows Mixed Reality immersive headset, the motion controller is the primary way to take action.
The Windows 10 update announced at Build 2017 and being released in the Sept-Nov 2017 timeframe.

The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that monitors your device and provides you with information and recommendations in a Health report to address common issues with your storage capacity, device drivers, battery life, or Windows Update.

The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that helps you refresh your device by reinstalling and updating Windows — for example, if your device has performance issues or you have too many unnecessary apps.
The pre-release version of Microsoft Remote Desktop app.
The pre-release version of Microsoft Remote Desktop app.
The period of time when users are required to schedule a restart.
A system service that enables spatial perception, spatial input, and holographic rendering.
The Microsoft interactive livestreaming platform for gaming communities.

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays mixed reality experiences. Used inclusively to denote both Microsoft HoloLens and OEM devices, whether they blend virtual content within the physical world (holographic headsets), or display virtual content with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness (immersive headsets)​. Plus, these headsets can either be self-contained (like Microsoft HoloLens - the whole computing power is contained into the headset) or PC-connected (the computing power comes from the PC and the headset cannot work without that associated PC).

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays mixed reality experiences. Used inclusively to denote both Microsoft HoloLens and OEM devices, whether they blend virtual content within the physical world (holographic headsets), or display virtual content with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness (immersive headsets)​. Plus, these headsets can either be self-contained (like Microsoft HoloLens - the whole computing power is contained into the headset) or PC-connected (the computing power comes from the PC and the headset cannot work without that associated PC).

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays virtual content only and with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness. This is a subset of "mixed reality headset."​ This is to be looked at in contrast with "holographic headsets".
The process of moving from a lower version of a system to a higher version. A configuration shift where the user becomes able to change default settings which were locked before the shift.
To move from a lower version of a system to a higher one, or to shift system configuration in order to change default settings locked before the shift.

The Windows feature for controlling the cursor, mouse clicks, text input, and communication with the movement of your eyes, using an on-screen keyboard and other software controls together with eye-tracking hardware​.

The service that provides OEMs working on Internet of Things (IoT) a channel through which they can update OEM devices with non-Microsoft component packages. These packages may contain drivers, applications, provisioning packages, settings, and data.
A cloud deployment solution that leverages the cloud to automate the configuration of new PCs including changing default start up screens without the need of IT assistance.
A cloud deployment solution that leverages the cloud to automate the configuration of new PCs including changing default start up screens without the need of IT assistance.

In Windows, an input panel where user can insert emojis and other expressive images or symbols. When using the en-US hardware keyboard to type, user can use SPACE+ : (colon) to input emoji in an easy and smart way. Rather than having to use the mouse, user can bring up the emoji panel and search or arrow key through the options. Eventually, this panel will include stickers and other expression objects.

The section in the Xbox Store where developers participating in the Xbox Live Creators Program publish their games directly. The collection offers exciting and diverse games that are fun to pick up and play.
An edition of Windows with unique support for server-grade hardware, and designed to meet demanding needs of mission-critical and compute-intensive workloads.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip to add an adventurous atmosphere and create a theme along with a related text style and music.

The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip to give it a classic look. This is also the name of a theme that applies this filter along with a related text style and music. It evokes a simple, classic, and elegant look and feel.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip to give it a slightly whitened, lightened, or bleached effect.
The black and white filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip.
The black and white filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip. This filter has deeper blacks and whiter whites than other filters.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it an effect of muted late evening light.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which intensifies the red and orange tones in the image.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which intensifies the blue tones in the image.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which intensifies the green tones in the image.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which intensifies the colors.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a slightly rough and worn out quality.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which sharpens the image and keeps colors intact.

The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a muted, blue-green effect. This is also the name of a theme that applies this filter along with a related text style and music. It evokes a subdued, cool, relaxed look and feel.

The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a feeling of energy, and the purple light you might see before an electrical storm. This is also the name of a theme that applies this filter along with a related text style and music.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a golden brownish hue like sand.

The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a cheerful, playful, sunny feeling. This is also the name of a theme that applies this filter along with a related text style and music.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which gives it a yellow tone.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which has a coarse texture and hard edges like metal.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which has the faded quality of photos taken in the mid-1960s.
The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip, which has a warm, sentimental feeling. This is also the name of a theme that applies this filter along with a related text style and music.
The text overlay style in Story Remix. This style is simple, classic, and fresh, with white text that animates in with a rising motion.
A text overlay style in Story Remix. This style resembles the typography of a printed book of poetry or a novel.
The text overlay style in Story Remix. This style is big, bold and uses very large type.
The text overlay style in Story Remix. This style is big, bold, and uses a colored block with transparent lettering that resembles a stencil or poster graphic.
A text overlay style in Story Remix, with a semi-opaque white background, and subtle typography.
The text overlay style in Story Remix, with white outlined, transparent lettering that looks modern, linear, and authentic.
The name of the premium experience for mixed reality when used with PC hardware that can support higher resolution/quality graphics.
The category of games that are optimized for Xbox One X console.

The extension for Cortana that connects users to custom services and solutions. Skills can be invoked on Cortana to perform certain actions, such as checking the user’s bank balance, reading a bed time story, or booking a cab with Uber.

A collection of policy settings that control updates for devices that use Windows 10. With these settings, information technology administrators decide when and which devices receive updates in their organization, and set different schedules for groups of devices. They can also pause updates for individual devices.
Microsoft Store as presented to the customer via the app in Windows 10.
Microsoft Store as presented to the customer via the app in all Xbox One consoles (including variants).
Microsoft Store as presented to the customer via Microsoft.com/store.
The app where users can find settings for Windows Mixed Reality.
The offer for Xbox Live Gold members that includes free games every month.
The offer for Xbox Live Gold members that includes exclusive discounts on games that are updated weekly. Users can save up to 50-75% on games in Microsoft Store on Xbox One.

The area in Windows Defender Security Center where people can see, access, and troubleshoot features related to their accounts, including device login, Windows Hello, Dynamic Lock, and other convenience and security features related to accounts and login.

The area in Windows Defender Security Center, within Ransomware protection, where customers can set up or initiate file restores with cloud providers, to help recover from a ransomware attack (which often encrypts files).
In the Windows Defender Security Center, the area within the Virus & threat protection section (pillar), where customers can find and use features to help prevent or recover from ransomware attacks.​
In Windows Defender Security Center, the area within the Virus & threat protection section (pillar) where customers can see the history of the threats found on their devices.

In Windows Defender Security Center app on Windows 10, the area within the Virus & threat protection section (pillar) where customers can see information about ​the definitions being used to recognize the latest threats on their device, and check for updates to those definitions.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.
The pre-release version of the Microsoft Photos Companion app.

A set of features in Windows 10 that elevate HDR content to a superior display quality, delivering the deepest blacks, the most dazzling brights, and more vivid detail across the entire color spectrum.

A package that contains the localized user interface components for Windows features. In the future, this may also include additional customization for a specific language, culture, or region. It is also a content type/subcategory in Microsoft Store.
The area in Windows Defender Security Center that highlights and helps customers troubleshoot the protection features built into the device.​
The app that lets users view what Windows diagnostic data and Office diagnostic data is sent to Microsoft from their device.​
The capability that provides Windows Hello with additional security for PIN, fingerprint, and facial recognition.​​
The capability of Windows Defender System Guard that protects a device from compromised firmware.​
The consumer-friendly name for trusted platform module (TPM)​.

The Windows 10 app that helps users get online easily and in more places on their Windows 10 PC. Users sign up for a data plan and connect with mobile operators in their area using a supported SIM card.

The app that enables Cortana to take over your mouse pointer and literally show you how to change a setting when you ask her to "show me (how to do something)." She performs each step for you in a sequence of clicks needed to make a particular change in Windows Settings.

The consumer-facing name for Hypervisor Code Integrity (HVCI). The HVCI service in Windows 10 determines whether code executing in kernel mode is securely designed and trustworthy, and helps ensure that all software running in kernel mode, including drivers, securely allocate memory and operate as they are intended.

The consumer-friendly name for virtualization-based security (VBS). The VBS service in Windows 10 uses hardware virtualization features to create and isolate a secure region of memory from the normal operating system.
A group of open tabs, including applications, files, pages, or websites, which can be saved together and re-opened together when you want to continue with that set of tabs.
The security feature for Windows 10 Enterprise that protects your device by providing startup and runtime protections that the operating system can validate and report on.
The security feature for Windows 10 Enterprise that protects your device by providing startup and runtime protections that the operating system can validate and report on.
The remote attestation service that checks the health of Windows 10-based devices to allow or deny access to networks, apps, or services, based on whether devices prove to be healthy.

The area in Windows Defender Security Center that helps customers keep their devices refreshed and up to date with the latest version of Windows 10. Device health advisor monitors the device and provides information and recommendations in a Health report to address common issues with storage capacity, device drivers, battery life, or Windows Update.
The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that helps protect devices running Windows 10 by checking web content that Microsoft Store apps use.​
The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that helps protect devices running Windows 10 from malicious websites and downloads.​​

The brand name for the device experience, the operating system and the device app platform from Microsoft that runs across PCs, tablets, laptops, phones, IoT devices, self-contained mixed reality headsets, large collaboration screens, and more.
A central processing unit on a microchip that made possible personal computers and workstations.
To proactively search for potential security threats and suspicious behavior.​

The transactional licensing agreement for commercial, government, and academic organizations with one or more users/devices, seeking to fully outsource management of their cloud services through a Cloud Solution Provider (CSP), with its primary focus on protecting partners, customers and Microsoft by providing the customer’s use rights, terms, and conditions granted for Microsoft Cloud product and service orders.
